unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate evidence based best practice management skills for the assessment and management of treating lymphoedema of the upper limb and breast (Scientist and Scholar)

Adapt assessment and intervention plans to meet needs of individuals from distinct social and/or cultural groups to ensure culturally respectful care for people with lymphoedema of the upper limb and breast (Engaged Global Citizen)
Use feedback from teachers, clinicians, peers and patients to inform self-evaluation and critical reflection of knowledge and skill development (Professional)

Demonstrate safe, effective, patient-centred skills and competencies in delivering high quality assessment and management strategies for treating lymphoedema of the upper limb and breast (Clinical Practitioner)

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: A component of this  micro unit will be presented as a series of well designed learning activities with embedded readings and knowledge checks.

enrolment_rules.description: AQF level 7 in a health degree or recognised equivalent with national registration if required.

assessments.description: Multiple choice questions and short answer

data.unit_offering_text: To be determined, Infrequent attendance, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: LYMP8003 - Lymphoedema Practice for the Upper Limb and Breast

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit is one of a series of units examining lymphoedema management for a specific region of the body. In this unit you will develop an understanding and insight into how lymphoedema of the upper limb and breast impacts an individual physically, functionally, psychologically, and financially. This unit will cover comprehensive assessment, clinical reasoning, communication and management skills to treat lymphoedema of the upper limb and breast using complex lymphoedema therapy (CLT). In this unit you will explore latest evidence based practice such as the theory of normal and abnormal lymphatic drainage pathways and patterns identified by Indocyanine Green (ICG) Lymphography for effective manual lymphatic drainage massage, compression therapy, exercise prescription, education, psychological well-being and surgical management. You will be encouraged to reflect on your own development. The unit will assist your development of all four graduate capabilities: Scientist and Scholar, Clinical Practitioner, Engaged Global Citizen and Professional.
data.search_title: LYMP8003 - Lymphoedema Practice for the Upper Limb and Breast
